obfuscation: Impossible !
original: Impossible!

obfuscation: Yes , it is true .
original: Yes, it is true.

obfuscation: A common sailor ?
original: A common sailor?

obfuscation: Oh fie !
original: Oh fie!

obfuscation: I blush for the weakness that allows me to cherish such a passion .
original: I blush for the weakness that allows me to cherish such a passion.

obfuscation: I hate myself when I think of the depth to which I have stooped in permitting myself to remember tenderly of one so ignobly born , but I love him !
original:
I hate myself when I think of the depth to which I have stooped
  in permitting myself to think tenderly of one so ignobly born, but I
  love him!

obfuscation: I love him !
original: I love him!

obfuscation: I love him !
original: I love him!

obfuscation: Come , my child , let us talk this over .
original: Come, my child, let us talk this over.

obfuscation: In a matter of the heart I would not coerce my daughter -- I attach but fiddling value to rank or wealth , but the line must be drawn somewhere .
original:
In a matter of the heart I
  would not coerce my daughter--I attach but little value to rank or
  wealth, but the line must be drawn somewhere.

obfuscation: A man in that station may be brave and worthy , but at every step he would commit solecismsthat society would never pardon .
original:
A man in that
  station may be brave and worthy, but at every step he would commit solecismsthat
  society would never pardon.

obfuscation: Oh , I have thought of this night and day .
original: Oh, I have thought of this night and day.

obfuscation: But fear not , father , I have a heart , and therefore I love ; but I am your daughter , and therefore I am proud .
original:
But fear not,
  father, I have a heart, and therefore I love; but I am your daughter, and therefore
  I am proud.

obfuscation: Though I carry my love with me to the tomb , he shall never , never know it .
original:
Though I carry my love with me to the tomb, he shall
  never, never know it.

obfuscation: You are my daughter after all .
original: You are my daughter after all.

obfuscation: But see , Sir Joseph 's barge approaches , manned by twelve trusty oarsmen and accompanied by the admiring crowd of sisters , cousins , and aunts that attend him wherever he goes .
original:
But see, Sir Joseph's barge
  approaches, manned by twelve trusty oarsmen and accompanied by
  the admiring crowd of sisters, cousins, and aunts that attend him
  wherever he
  goes.

obfuscation: Retire , my daughter , to your cabin -- take this , his photograph , with you -- it may help to bring you to a more reasonable frame of mind .
original:
Retire, my daughter, to your cabin--take this, his
  photograph, with you--it may help to bring you to a more reasonable frame of mind.

obfuscation: My own thoughtful father !
original: My own thoughtful father!

obfuscation: Over the bright blue sea Comes Sir Joseph Porter , K.C.B. , Wherever he may become Bang-bang the loud nine-pounders go !
original:
Over the bright blue sea
                    Comes Sir Joseph Porter, K.C.B.,
                      Wherever he may go
                    Bang-bang the loud nine-pounders go!

obfuscation: Shout o'er the bright blue sea For Sir Joseph Porter , K.C.B .
original:
Shout o'er the bright blue sea
                    For Sir Joseph Porter, K.C.B.

obfuscation: Sir Joseph 's barge is seen , And its crowd of blushing beauties , We hope he 'll find us clean , And attentive to our duties .
original:
Sir Joseph's barge is seen,
                 And its crowd of blushing beauties,
            We hope he'll find us clean,
                 And attentive to our duties.

obfuscation: We sail , we sail the ocean blue , And our saucy ship 's a beauty .
original:
We sail, we sail the ocean blue,
                 And our saucy ship's a beauty.

obfuscation: We 're sober , sober men and true And attentive to our duty .
original:
We're sober, sober men and true
                 And attentive to our duty.

obfuscation: We 're smart and sober men , And quite devoid of fe-ar , In all the Royal N. None are so smart as we are .
original:
We're smart and sober men,
                 And quite devoid of fe-ar,
            In all the Royal N.
                 None are so smart as we are.
